column4: Why isn't my clock automatically being synced to a time server?
that isn't set up by default afaik
that's silly
why?
it involves installing more packages (easily done via gui)
why would you not synchronize?
because you haven't got the internet?
so then the synchronization fails. It should still try by default
if you can synchronise you can quickly dl a couple of packages which would have taken up space ont he cd
I'm saying it should be default
by your login, ubuntu should do nothing and come with no software by default and the user should have to know to install everything.
ubuntu has a big "one cd install" thing going on.
Its about 3 or 4 clicks and a password to get that working.
please stay on topic.
that is not recommended. /msg ubotu upgrade
are you kidding?
I am not no.
ubuntu != ubuntu
please "/msg ubotu upgrade" and read the recommended method.
its not broken, its just safer to use the upgrade-manager tools
that's fine
only when upgrade distributions is it highly recommended to use upgrade-manager
